business.headline: Sensex, Nifty open flat as markets ignore fresh US tariff threat; TCS down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 116.63 points to 84,844.51, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 33.70 points to 26,107.05 as of 9:22 am.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will market open lower after 500% tariff threat from US?Markets have been under pressure for several sessions. The Nifty 50 has slipped 0.7% over the last three trading days, while the BSE Sensex has declined 0.9% during the same period.

Trump bars defence company payouts until weapons production speeds upTrump and senior Pentagon officials have repeatedly criticised major defence companies for failing to deliver weapons and systems at the pace demanded by modern conflicts. They have argued that lengthy delays and ballooning budgets weaken US military readiness and undermine taxpayer confidence.

Darkest day of my life: Vedanta's Anil Agarwal's son dies of cardiac arrest at 49Agarwal's post referenced a longstanding pledge made between father and son to support several social priorities, such as food access, education for children, empowering women, and secure employment for young Indians. Agarwal renewed the promise to devote over 75% of group earnings to initiatives that benefit society.

Union Budget to be presented on Sunday, Feb 1; Economic Survey on Jan 29This will be only the second time the Union Budget will be presented on a Sunday. In 1999, the Budget was presented on a Sunday for the first time.

Silver jumps Rs 5000 to hit record high of Rs 2.56 lakh per kg in Delhi marketsSilver prices jumped by Rs 5,000 to a fresh all-time high of Rs 2.56 lakh per kilogram in the Delhi market, driven by strong safe-haven demand, robust industrial buying and supply concerns.

Budget 2026: Why insurance and policy reforms are in focusAs Budget 2026 approaches, the insurance industry is pushing for structural tax reforms, enhanced retirement security, and measures to improve access to inclusive insurance products, focusing on how policy direction will impact premium financing and sector growth.

Netflix offering better value: Warner Bros rejects Paramount's revised hostile bidParamount launched a hostile takeover bid worth USD 108.4 billion for Warner Bros. Discovery on December 8, disrupting Warner Bros' preliminary merger talks with Netflix.

Budget 2026: Last year's income tax changes and what may be in focus this timeBudget 2025 delivered meaningful relief to a large section of salaried taxpayers, sharply narrowed the gap between the old and new tax regimes, and set the direction for how personal taxation would evolve going forward.

India's GDP growth expected at 7.4% in FY26Government measures played an important role in supporting growth. Income tax relief and steps to rationalise GST rates helped shore up consumer demand, even as global conditions remained uncertain.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as auto, energy stocks drag despite IT gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 102.20 points to close at 84,961.14, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 37.95 points to end at 26,140.75.

Airfare spike under scanner as government seeks data from major airlines: ReportIndia's Directorate General of Civil Aviation, which oversees safety, has written to airlines asking for average fares on each route they operated on, for economy and premium economy seats, over the period December 1-15, according to a report.

Employer not paying salary or incentives? Here's what you can doCases of delayed salaries, unpaid incentives and withheld bonuses have become more frequent, especially in young companies and firms facing cash stress. Legal experts say salary and incentives are not favours.

How Sebi's 15% rule sets a ceiling on broker growth, explains Zerodha's Nithin KamathNithin Kamath said Sebi has fixed a 15% open interest limit for brokers in the derivatives market. This means no single broker is allowed to hold more than 15% of the total market open interest at any given time.

The hidden cost quietly eating up to 25% of your mutual fund returnsA study by 1 Finance Research shows that over a 10-year holding period, more than 80% of equity mutual fund schemes leave investors in regular plans at least 25% worse off than those invested in the direct plan of the same scheme.

Silver prices drop over Rs 5,000, gold slips more than Rs 1,100. Check latest ratesAfter a strong rally in recent sessions, gold and silver prices turned lower on Wednesday. Silver saw a fall of more than Rs 5,000, while gold also became cheaper by more than Rs 1,100.

Inside India's insurance mis-selling problem and why it remains hard to fixInsurance mis-selling remains widespread even under regulatory watch. How does it keep slipping past rules, checks, and repeated warnings? Read on to find out.

Amazon Pay launches fixed deposit service with returns of up to 8%. Check detailsAmazon Pay users can now do more than just pay bills and shop online. The company has launched a fixed deposit service that lets customers invest in FDs through the app, with returns going up to 8%.

Explained: Why Venezuela's stock market jumped 50% in a day after the US attackThe benchmark Venezuela IBC Index, which tracks shares traded in Caracas (capital of Venezuela), surged 50% in a single session on Tuesday.

Titan share price up 4%: Why is the Jhunjhunwala stock rising today?The stock opened higher at Rs 4,200.45 compared with the previous close of Rs 4,111.10. During the session, it touched an intraday high of Rs 4282.00 and a low of Rs 4,200.45. The volume-weighted average price stood at Rs 4,254.78.

entertainment.headline: Disney's Tangled finds its magic duo in Teagan Croft and Milo Manheim Disney has confirmed that Teagan Croft and Milo Manheim will play Rapunzel and Flynn Rider respectively in the upcoming live-action reimagining of Tangled, following a lengthy casting process and anticipation from fans.

No censor clearance for Parasakthi yet: Will it face Jana Nayagan delay drama? Sivakarthikeyan's Parasakthi awaits censor board clearance ahead of its January 10 release. The delay raises concerns of a repeat of Jana Nayagan's censor troubles and impacts theatre bookings.

Director Rakeysh Mehra shares Delhi-6 ending that never made it to Indian theatres Filmmaker Rakeysh Omprakash Mehra discussed the unreleased version of his 2009 film 'Delhi-6', and reflected on why he changed the ending for its Indian release.

SRK's iconic Badshah track stuns America's Got Talent judges. Watch Shah Rukh Khan's iconic track from the film 'Badshah' found its fans on the stage of America's Got Talent. A group choreographed their gig on the film's title track, which left the judges amazed.

Circumstances beyond control: Jana Nayagan makers speak out on film's postponement Makers of Jana Nayagan issued their first official statement after postponing Vijay's film's scheduled January 9 release due to a delay in censor certificate approval, amid legal proceedings and content review concerns.

What Vijay's exit means for Tamil cinema: Decoding actor's box office dominance Thalapathy Vijay's departure marks the end of a specific era. The question isn't whether Tamil cinema will survive without him, but how long it will take to find someone who can replicate even a fraction of what he brought to screens.

Send Help: Rachel McAdams, Dylan O'Brien fight to survive in new trailer A new trailer and poster of 'Send Help', directed by Sam Raimi, were unveiled on January 7. The film, starring Rachel McAdams and Dylan O'Brien, is set for theatrical release in India on January 30, 2026.

Amy Schumer and Chris Fischer divorce, focus on co-parenting their son Amy Schumer filed for divorce from Chris Fischer. The separation marks the official end of their seven-year marriage, with both prioritising their son's well-being and maintaining an amicable relationship.

The Bluff: Priyanka Chopra's fierce, bloodied pirate look from gritty drama out Priyanka Chopra Jonas and Karl Urban are set to lead the cast of Prime Video's upcoming drama 'The Bluff'. The first look of the actors from the Russo Brothers' pirate film was unveiled on January 7.

From Uri to real life: Aditya Dhar reacts to Vicky-Katrina naming son Vihaan Filmmaker Aditya Dhar responded warmly to Vicky Kaushal and Katrina Kaif naming their newborn son Vihaan. He noted the coincidence with Kaushal's role as Major Vihaan Shergill in the 2019 film Uri: The Surgical Strike.

Bhooth Bangla: Akshay Kumar's horror-comedy confirms May release. Check date here The makers of Bhooth Bangla, starring Akshay Kumar and Tabu, have announced a new release date for the much-anticipated horror comedy film. It was earlier slated to release on April 2.

Taskaree trailer: Emraan Hashmi leads high-stakes customs war on smugglers The trailer for Taskaree: The Smuggler's Web, featuring Emraan Hashmi, is out now. Directed by Neeraj Pandey, the Netflix series is set to premiere on January 14.

Ranveer Singh vs Ranbir Kapoor: Who is Bollywood's true box office Dhurandhar? A comparative analysis of Ranveer Singh and Ranbir Kapoor's box office performances highlights shifting trends, as Dhurandhar sets new industry benchmarks. Who's leading, who's trailing – let's have a look.

Vijay's Jana Nayagan release postponed after court setback, new date awaited Amid the censor delay row, Thalapathy Vijay's much-anticipated film Jana Nayagan has been postponed. The film was slated to release on January 9. In an official statement, the makers have confirmed that a new release date will be announced soon.

Cobra director backs Jana Nayagan amid censor delay row: Absolute misuse of power Cobra director Ajay R Gnanamuthu has expressed solidarity with Thalapathy Vijay's Jana Nayagan team following the film's release postponement. He highlighted the efforts of the film crew in an X post and commented on the broader impact of the delay.

Yash cancels 40th birthday fan meet, says Toxic is his priority Yash informed his fans there would be no birthday meet this year as he dedicates his attention to finishing the film Toxic: A Fairy Tale for Grown-Ups. In a lengthy note on Instagram, the actor apologised and promised something bigger.

Hema Malini recalls unsettling early days in Mumbai, living in haunted house Hema Malini, famed for her work in Hindi cinema, shared a story from early days in Mumbai, including living in a haunted house.

Sonu Nigam performs Ghar Kab Aaoge for Mumbai Police ahead of Border 2 release Singer Sonu Nigam performed Ghar Kab Aaoge from the upcoming film Border 2 as a tribute to Mumbai Police. The film is set to release across theatres on January 23.

Anil Kapoor marks 43 years of his Kannada debut, lauds Yash and Rishab Shetty Veteran actor Anil Kapoor celebrates 43 years since his Kannada film debut Pallavi Anu Pallavi. He applauds the booming Kannada cinema industry and hints at future collaborations.

general news.headline: More trouble for India? Trump-backed bill threatens 500% tariffs over Russian oilRepublican Senator Lindsey Graham said President Donald Trump cleared the new sanctions bill after they held a "productive" meeting on Wednesday, adding that it could be put to vote as early as next week.

US, Russia tensions rise after oil tanker seizure: A blow-by-blow accountA high-seas seizure of a Russian-flagged oil tanker by US forces has brought Washington and Moscow to the brink of a new diplomatic clash. Russia has called the move illegal, while the US says it was enforcing sanctions linked to Venezuela.

Coach lures teen Haryana shooter to hotel for performance review, rapes herA national shooting coach allegedly raped a 17-year-old shooter inside a hotel room in Faridabad after calling her under the pretext of evaluating her performance. Police said the accused forced her into the hotel room where the incident occurred.

US exits dozens of international agencies, including India-led Solar AllianceThe White House said on Wednesday that Trump signed a proclamation pulling the US out of 35 non-United Nations bodies and 31 United Nations-linked entities following a sweeping review of America's global commitments.

Jets selling like hot cakes after India war, won't need IMF loan: Pak's new claimPakistan's Defence Minister, Khwaja Asif, has claimed that Islamabad was getting record orders for fighter jets and wouldn't need IMF's financial assistance after six months. This, he said, came after the four-day mini-war with India. Here's a look at Pak's public debt and liabilities vis-a-vis Asif's claim.

Bangladesh unfairly treated? What to make of ICC's firm T20 World Cup standThe Bangladesh Cricket Board is hurt by the abrupt termination of Mustafizur Rahman's IPL contract. But is seeking relocation of T20 World Cup matches from India fair? The ICC has insisted Bangladesh stick to the original schedule.

Darkest day of my life: Vedanta's Anil Agarwal's son dies of cardiac arrest at 49Agarwal's post referenced a longstanding pledge made between father and son to support several social priorities, such as food access, education for children, empowering women, and secure employment for young Indians. Agarwal renewed the promise to devote over 75% of group earnings to initiatives that benefit society.

We are satisfied: Poland backs India as US turns up heat over Russian oilWe are satisfied, said Poland Foreign Minister Radosaw Sikorski as he backed India as New Delhi faces sharp tariff threats from the US over its continued imports of Russian crude oil.

What Vijay's exit means for Tamil cinema: Decoding actor's box office dominanceThalapathy Vijay's departure marks the end of a specific era. The question isn't whether Tamil cinema will survive without him, but how long it will take to find someone who can replicate even a fraction of what he brought to screens.

Humanoids and smart machines dazzle at CES 2026, here are our top 5 picksCES is back, and once again, the tech industry is showcasing its latest innovations at the show. This year, it seems that trend has moved to humanoid robots and AI gadgets. From adorable robot pets that die if you neglect them, to humanoids that you can do your laundry, we have seen everything. And here are our top 5 picks from CES 2026.

Phone stolen in Varanasi, Mumbai techie tracks it herself after cop inactionWith help from friends, the woman tracked her stolen phone to a house in Varanasi, informed police, and enabled the recovery of her handset along with 12 other stolen mobile phones.

Bengali food, NYC, and Mayor Mamdani — enough saidTo mark a successful second day in office, Mamdani wrapped up his day with a hearty Bengali meal from Boishakhi, a Bangladeshi restaurant on 36th Avenue in Astoria, Queens.

Video: Hit from behind, auto crushed between 2 buses in Bhubaneswar; driver killedThe crash, captured on video, led to chaos at the site, with the bus driver and conductor fleeing the scene and police launching a search.

North India braces for freezing conditions today as cold wave peaksNorth India faces a severe cold wave and dense fog, disrupting travel in Delhi and Punjab on January 8. Meanwhile, a depression in the Bay of Bengal brings heavy rain warnings for Tamil Nadu.
Not Goa, not Jaipur but this Indian destination is winning over global travellersA city in Kerala has emerged as the fastest-growing destination for international travellers visiting India.

Wise choice: Trump says Venezuela to buy only US-made goods from oil deal moneyUS President Donald Trump said Venezuela will use profits from a new oil deal to buy only American-made goods, calling it a win for US industry and Venezuelan recovery.

Bengaluru man works as Rapido bike captain for 4 days, shares earnings breakdownThe man shared a transparent breakdown of hours worked, earnings and expenses after riding part-time with Rapido, primarily during late-night hours.

No censor clearance for Parasakthi yet: Will it face Jana Nayagan delay drama?Sivakarthikeyan's Parasakthi awaits censor board clearance ahead of its January 10 release. The delay raises concerns of a repeat of Jana Nayagan's censor troubles and impacts theatre bookings.

Another BNP leader Azizur Rahman Musabbir shot dead in DhakaMusabbir, who had served as general secretary of Dhaka Metropolitan North Swechchhasebak Dal, the volunteer wing of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party, was targeted near the Super Star Hotel in the Karwan Bazaar area around 8.30 pm (local time).

US immigration officer fatally shoots woman during Minneapolis crackdownHomeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem, speaking during a visit to Texas, defended the officer's actions and the enforcement operation. She described the incident as an "act of domestic terrorism" directed at ICE officers.

The Bluff: Priyanka Chopra's fierce, bloodied pirate look from gritty drama outPriyanka Chopra Jonas and Karl Urban are set to lead the cast of Prime Video's upcoming drama 'The Bluff'. The first look of the actors from the Russo Brothers' pirate film was unveiled on January 7.

Can Trump be impeached this year?US President Donald Trump has warned Republicans that if the party fails to get a majority in November's midterm elections this year, he might be impeached. What are the chances?

Trump heaps insults on NATO allies again, says it's nothing without AmericaDonald Trump claimed he had pushed allies to spend as much as 5 per cent of GDP on defence and to pay "immediately", portraying the shift as a personal achievement. Trump also asserted that without his involvement, Russia would have already taken control of all of Ukraine.

10 daughters and 19 years later, Haryana couple have baby boyThe gynaecologist who assisted with the delivery expressed both surprise at the occurrence and concern over the potential health impacts on the woman's uterus from so many natural births.

sports.headline: What's all this brother? Ashwin amazed by Vaibhav Suryavanshi's run-scoring spree Former India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin summed up the awe around Vaibhav Suryavanshi's staggering run spree. At just 14, the teenage opener is redefining age-group dominance ahead of the Under-19 World Cup and IPL 2026.

Australia win Ashes in style, hand England 4-1 defeat, Bazball reality check Australia secured a 4-1 series victory in the Ashes 2025-26 with a five-wicket win in the final Test in Sydney. The Steve Smith-led side chased down the target of 160 in the second session to complete a dominant series.

Versatile Beau Webster steps up in Tests as pressure grows on Cameron Green Ashes: Beau Webster's batting and off-spin on Day 4 of the final Test against England have boosted his selection prospects and intensified the pressure on Cameron Green as Australia's Test all-rounder.

Asia Cup hero Tilak Varma suffers abdomen injury before T20 World Cup: Report India have suffered a major blow ahead of T20 World Cup as Tilak Varma has sustained an abdominal injury. He's unlikely to feature in the T20I series against New Zealand.

Shubman Gill meets KSI: India captain and British YouTuber link up in Mumbai India ODI and Test captain Shubman Gill met global YouTube star KSI in Mumbai during the latter's India visit. The casual crossover caught fans' attention ahead of Gill's return to international cricket.

Harmanpreet's captaincy record untouchable, has 4-5 more years in her: Jhulan Jhulan Goswami praised Harmanpreet Kaur's record as India captain and her WPL success with Mumbai Indians. She believes Harmanpreet has four to five years of cricket left and an unmatched legacy ahead of her.

Malaysia Open live: Lakshya Sen squanders lead to lose Game 1 Malaysia Open live score: Ayush Shetty was handed a tough but fighting defeat by reigning World Champions Shi Qui in their Men's Round of 16 clash. Up next, Lakshya Sen takes on Lee Cheik Yu.

Bangladesh unfairly treated? What to make of ICC's firm T20 World Cup stand The Bangladesh Cricket Board is hurt by the abrupt termination of Mustafizur Rahman's IPL contract. But is seeking relocation of T20 World Cup matches from India fair? The ICC has insisted Bangladesh stick to the original schedule.

Manager-less Manchester United continue dull ways with Burnley draw Manchester United's post-Amorim reset stalled at Turf Moor as familiar flaws resurfaced. Benjamin Sesko shone with a brace, yet defensive lapses and late concession ensured another draw, deepening uncertainty before crucial FA Cup decisions looming.

Start from zero: Shadab Khan relishes dream comeback with T20 World Cup in sight SL vs PAK, 1st T20I: Shadab Khan marked his T20I comeback with a Player of the Match performance against Sri Lanka, stressing that international returns mean starting from zero and focusing on one step at a time.

Shaheen Afridi likely to recover within a week, T20 World Cup 2026 plans on trackShaheen Afridi, Pakistan cricket team, knee injury update, Shaheen Afridi rehab, PCB medical team, T20 cricket Pakistan, Pakistan fast bowlers, Shaheen Afridi fitness, Lahore Qalandars, Pakistan cricket news

'India Is A Very Safe Place': Telangana Minister On Bangladesh Security ConcernsA Telangana minister and former Indian cricket captain addresses the recent concerns raised by the Bangladesh Cricket Association regarding security for the T20 World Cup in India. Dismissing these apprehensions, the speaker asserts, 'I think India is a very safe place,' and emphasizes that the tournament will proceed in the country with 'no second way.' The interviewee suggests that any decision made by the BCCI would have been discussed with the government, prioritizing the larger interest of security. Referring to the situation as Bangladesh's 'lookout,' the former captain expresses confidence in India's security system. The discussion also briefly touches upon a recent controversy involving a Bangladeshi cricketer. The minister concludes by affirming that the event will go ahead as planned, regardless of the concerns raised.

Tata Steel Chess: Viswanathan Anand rolls back the years to share Rapid lead on Day 1Former world champion Viswanathan Anand marked his return with two key wins to end day one tied at the top with Hans Niemann, as Carissa Yip led the women's section with 2.5 points after three rounds.

Lionel Messi dismisses coaching interest, prefers club ownership after retirementLionel Messi expresses a clear preference for club ownership over coaching after his playing career, following a season of record-breaking achievements. The football legend outlines his vision for youth development and continued involvement in football off the pitch.

How Jasprit Bumrah inspired Shreyanka Patil to bounce back after injuryIndian all-rounder Shreyanka Patil credits Jasprit Bumrah's guidance during her injury-hit layoff for helping her regain confidence as she prepares for a WPL 2026 comeback with RCB against Mumbai Indians.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi's heroics with bat and ball leads India-U19 to 3-0 whitewashVaibhav Suryavanshi led from the front with a century and a wicket as India U-19 crushed South Africa by 233 runs to seal a dominant 3-0 whitewash in the Youth ODI series.

Bangladesh firm on T20 World Cup stance: No cricket at cost of national dignityBangladesh have remained firm on their decision not to play T20 World Cup matches in India, citing security and national humiliation concerns following Mustafizur Rahman's exit from Kolkata Knight Riders, which has escalated tensions with India.

Don't like India-Pakistan cricket beef: Ex-West Indies captain calls for unityJason Holder says the India–Pakistan divide is sad and should not overshadow cricket. The West Indies all-rounder believes sport can play a role in easing political tensions.

England must now move on from failed Bazball project after Ashes: VaughanEngland must finally move away from their high-risk 'Bazball' approach and return to Test cricket basics after their Ashes defeat, former captain Michael Vaughan said in an interview with Reuters on Wednesday.

Shreyas Iyer declared fit by BCCI, cleared for New Zealand ODI seriesShreyas Iyer has been declared fit for international cricket after receiving clearance from the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) Centre of Excellence (CoE), removing the final medical hurdle ahead of India's ODI series against New Zealand.

New Zealand worried about ODI series vs India, not T20 World Cup: Daryl MitchellNew Zealand are not dwelling on the T20 World Cup, which is still a month away, and are instead focused on the immediate challenge of taking on India's bowlers in the upcoming white-ball series, batter Daryl Mitchell said on Wednesday.

Harmanpreet Kaur credits WPL, Mumbai Indians for bringing that winning mindset in herAhead of the Women's Premier League season in Mumbai, players and coaches highlight the transformative impact of the franchise and the WPL on Indian women's cricket, linking domestic professionalism to international triumphs.

Solskjaer, Carrick frontrunners for caretaker role at Manchester United: ReportManchester United are weighing up a short-term return to familiar faces, with Ole Gunnar Solskjær and Michael Carrick emerging as the leading contenders to take over as caretaker manager until the end of the season, according to reports.

Yo Yo Honey Singh, Jacqueline Fernandez set to perform in WPL 2026 opening ceremonyYo Yo Honey Singh and Jacqueline Fernandez will headline the WPL 2026 opening ceremony in Navi Mumbai, adding star power and high-energy entertainment ahead of the RCB vs MI season opener on Friday, January 9.

Gujarat Giants bank on Renuka Singh boost to change fortunesWPL 2026: Fast bowler Renuka Singh, who played the first three seasons for the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB), is now set to represent the Gujarat Titans in the Women's Premier League.

Kobbie Mainoo returns to training for Manchester United after Ruben Amorim's sackingKobbie Mainoo returned to training as Manchester United prepares for life after Ruben Amorim. The midfielder could feature against Burnley as Darren Fletcher takes interim charge.

Virat Kohli mobbed by fans on arrival at Vadodara ahead of New Zealand ODIs: WatchVirat Kohli received a rousing welcome in Vadodara ahead of India's ODI series against New Zealand. The batting great arrives in red-hot form for his first international outing of 2026.

New Year, same hunger: Vaibhav Suryavanshi smashes 63-ball hundred in South AfricaIndia vs South Africa, 3rd Youth ODI: Vaibhav Suryavanshi hit a 63-ball hundred, bringing up his first three-figure score on South African soil. The 14-year-old was leading India U19 against South Africa on Wednesday.

Pakistan hopeful of pacer Shaheen Afridi's recovery ahead of T20 World CupPakistan's T20 captain Salman Ali Agha has expressed optimism over Shaheen Shah Afridi's recovery from a knee injury, saying the premier pacer is on track to regain full fitness in time for next month's T20 World Cup.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
